alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 31 at 12:31PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: .After further analysis from previous events and with no response yet on the USGS Mendenhall Lake gauge we have extended the watch. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR A GLACIER-DAMMED LAKE OUTBURST NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by a glacier-dammed lake outburst continues to be possible. * WHERE...The Mendenhall Lake and River, areas around the glacier visitor center, the Mendenhall campground, Skaters Cabin Road, View Drive and possibly below Back Loop bridge. * WHEN...Through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of other low-lying areas and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Latest webcam image from Suicide Basin shows water levels dropping although Mendenhall Lake remains steady around 5.8 ft. It is possible that the drop in basin water levels was caused from further melting of the ice dam and lowering the water level in Suicide Basin. Looking at previous release dates combined with current water levels, best estimations show Mendenhall Lake could reach moderate flood stage of around 11 ft by Thursday afternoon. We continue to monitor the situation as more data comes available. - If you live near or along the Mendenhall Lake and River, stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
